module.p: latha day is a masculine temporal unit simple common noun.

section.p:
Some examples with a definite article pre-specifier –
older pedagogical examples –
Bha an latha brèagha blàth is thug an athair leis Iain agus Anna anns a’ chàr. [...]
The day was lovely and warm and their father took John and Ann in the car. [...] td. 6

Some examples –
latha brèagha a lovely day
latha blàth a warm day

module.p:
rach air làithean saora go on holiday/vacation –
pedagogical examples –
Cha tèid Màiri air lathaichean saora ged a bhios an t-airgead aice.
Mary will not go on holiday even though she will have the money. td. 105

thig air làithean saora come on holiday/vacation –
pedagogical examples –
Tha mac mo pheathar agus bràthair m’ athar a’ tighinn gar n-ionnsaigh air an lathaichean saora.
My nephew and my uncle are coming (to visit us) on their holidays. td. 99

Examples from Gairm –
[...] “Thainig e mach á sgoth-luing le na siùil gheala. Cha robh facal Gàidhlig aige. [...] Tha thu coltach ris [...]. ’Be an samhradh a bh’ ann. [...] Bha mise ’g ionnsachadh na Beurla. Cha robh esan math air a’ Ghàidhlig. [...] Aon latha dh’fhalbh e. Anns an t-soitheich.” [...]
[...] “He came out of a yacht with white sails. He didn’t have a word of Gaelic. [...] You look like him. [...] It was the summer. [...] I was learning English. He wasn’t good at Gaelic. [...] One day he left. In the boat.” [...] td. 170–1, le Iain Mac a’ Ghobhainn
[...] ’Se madainn bhòidheach foghair a bh’ ann—tioram, le ceileir eòin, is beagan dealt air an fheur. Bha a[m] muir ’s na tighean ag éirigh á inntinn an latha. [...]
[...] It was a beautiful autumn morning – dry, with the chirping of birds, and a little dew on the grass. The sea and the houses were rising from the mind of the day [??]. [...] td. 169, le Iain Mac a’ Ghobhainn
